Lesson 1: Introduction to Visual Analytics

Published

January 3, 2023

Content

  • Course Overview
  • Motivation of Visual Analytics
  • What Visual Analytics is
  • Visual Analytics in History
  • Intents of Visual Analytics Applications
  • Visual Analytics Techniques: basic graphical methods
  • Visual Analytics Tools

Lesson Slides and Hands-on Notes

  • Lesson slides in html and pdf formats

  • Lesson 1 (Supplement): Choosing the Right Visualisation in html and pdf formats.

  • Handout of In-class Exercise 1 in html and pdf formats.

In-class Exercise

By the end of this lesson, you will gain hands-on experience on:

  • creating the course website by using Quarto and RStudio,
  • managing the website by using git/github by using RStudio
  • publishing the website onto Netlify server

Self-reading Before Lesson

Webinars

  • The best Hans Rosling talks you’ve ever seen.
  • VIVA – What is Visual Analytics?
  • Why Visual Analytics
  • Visual Analytics - Mastering the Information Age

Readings

  • Thomas, J.J. & Cook, K.A. (2006) “A Visual Analytics Agenda”, ‘’IEEE Computer Graphics and Applications’’, January 2006, Vol.26(1), pp.10-13
  • Chabot, C (2009) “Demystifying Visual Analytics”, ‘’IEEE Computer Graphics and Applications’’, March 2009, Vol.29(2), pp.84-87.
  • The 5 Most Influential Data Visualizations of All Time
  • J.J. Thomas and K.A. Cook, eds. (2005) Illuminating the Path: The Research and Development Agenda for Visual Analytics, IEEE CS Press.
  • Jun, Yuan et. al. (2020) “A survey of visual analytics techniques for machine learning”, Computational Visual Media. doi.org/10.1007/s41095-020-0191-7.
  • Cui, Wenqiang (2019) “Visual Analytics: A Comprehensive Overview”, IEEE Access.

Statistical Graphics Methods

Boxplot

  • Understanding Boxplots
  • Regina L. Nuzzo (2016) “The Box Plots Alternative for Visualizing Quantitative Data”, PR&M, Volume8, Issue3, pp. 268-272.

Violin Plots

  • Violin Plot-wikipedia
  • Hintze, Jerry L.; Nelson, Ray D. (1998). “Violin Plots: A Box Plot-Density Trace Synergism”. The American Statistician. 52 (2): 181–4
  • Violin Plot by LondonSODA.

Notched Box Plots

  • Notched Box Plots

Dot Plots

  • Dot plots
  • Dot Plots: A Useful Alternative to Bar Charts
  • The dot plot: A graphical tool for data analysis and presentation
  • Leland Wilkinson (1999) “Dot Plot”, Statistical Computing and Graphics, Vol. 53, No. 3, pp. 276-281.

Pie chart and Bar chart

  • Understanding Pie Charts
  • Tracey L. Weissgerber et. al. (2015) “Beyond Bar and Line Graphs: Time for a New Data Presentation Paradigm”, PLoS Biology.

Raincloud Plots

  • Allen M, Poggiali D, Whitaker K et al. “Raincloud plots: a multi-platform tool for robust data. visualization” [version 2; peer review: 2 approved]. Welcome Open Res 2021, pp. 4:63.

Trellis Display

  • The Visual Design and Control of Trellis Display
  • Trellis display
  • Trellis Displays vs. Interactive Graphics

All About Tableau

Things about Tableau you must know!

  • Polaris: A System for Query, Analysis,and Visualization of Multidimensional Relational Databases
  • Tableau Technology
  • Show Me: Automatic Presentation for Visual Analysis
  • Whitepaper: Visual Analysis for Everyone
  • Analytics Best Practices in Tableau

Learning Tableau

  • Getting Started
  • Tableau Interface
  • Getting Started with Visual Analytics
  • Formatting
  • The Formatting Pane
  • Reference lines
  • Getting Started with Data also self-learn the remaining videos under ’‘’Connecting to Data’’’
  • Getting Started with Tableau Prep Builder. This is a brand-new product from Tableau designed to help everyone quickly and confidently combine, shape, and clean their data for analysis. You can learn more about Tableau Data Prep here. You are encouraged to view all the 12 videos under ’‘’Tableau Prep’’’.
